docs.lead_paragraph: BOGOTA, Colombia, March 2--Two officals of the Colombian Foreign Ministry met with a young terrorist today in the first face-to-face talks in the four days...
docs.abstract: Ramiro Zambrano and Camilo Jimenez, 2 officials of Colombian Foreign Ministry, meet with a young terrorist in first face-to-face talks; Mexican Ambassador Ricardo Galan, who is among hostages, is also present; guerrillas release 5 hostages ninety minutes after meeting, bringing to 23 number they have freed; statement issued from offices of Pres Julio Cesar Turbay Ayala says that 'dialogue' with guerrillas will continue at unspecified date and time; Frank H Perez, deputy director of State Dept Office for Combating Terrorism, reiterates US position that negotiations are solely in hands of Colombian Government; illustration of Amb Galan with hostage (M)

headline.main: 2 COLOMBIAN AIDES AND GUERRILLA TALK NEAR SITE OF SIEGE; Captive Mexican Envoy Also Joins 45-Minute Discussions in Van --5 More Hostages Freed 'Dialogue' to Continue U.S. Not Part of Negotiations 2 COLOMBIAN AIDES AND GUERRILLA MEET Troops Keep Out of Sight Identity of Woman Unknown

docs.lead_paragraph: Tony Trabert did not sound bitter, just disappointed. "It's too bad some players regard tennis more as a business than anything else," the Davis Cup captain said on returning from Buenos Aires, where the United States, the defending champion, was eliminated by Argentina in the American Zone final last week.

docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, March 24--The Carter Administration, moving to counter the inflationary effects of protecting domestic industry from foreign competition, ruled today against raising tariffs on imports of tomatoes from Mexico and leather wearing apparel, mainly from South Korea.
docs.abstract: Pres Carter, in move designed to underscore Adm's commitment to its new anti-inflation program, rules against raising tariffs on certain imports (M)

headline.main: Colombian Guerrillas Free 2 More At Embassy, Reducing Total to 27

docs.snippet: BOGOTA, Colombia, April 4 (UPI)  Leftist guerrillas released two of the six remaining nondiplomatic hostages from the Dominican Republic Embassy today, but they showed no willingness to free any of the 19 captive diplomats soon.

headline.main: 2 More Captives Set Free in Bogota; No Early Release for 23 Is Expected; 33 Are Freed So Far
